EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Electricity Groups comprising many Small Electric Poles. The original configuration (with poles at positions such as (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5), (x=1.5, y=22.5), etc.) has been reconfigured. Recent updates add new poles at (x=3.5, y=22.5) – to strengthen connectivity near the Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) – and at (x=-4.5, y=17.5) near the Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5).
• Steam Engines including a primary engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) and additional engines at (x=-14.5, y=13.5), (x=7.5, y=35.5), and (x=8.5, y=20.5).
• Fluid System Submodule (Boiler Module) comprising:
 – A Boiler at (x=-13.5, y=19.0) with a noted connection issue near (x=-17.5, y=21.5).
 – A repositioned Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with boiler at (x=-10.0, y=22.5) and steam engine at (x=-7.5, y=11.5).
 – An additional attempted Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with boiler at (x=-7.0, y=23.5) and steam engine at (x=1.5, y=28.5).
 – A successfully connected pair with boiler at (x=-2.0, y=15.5) and steam engine at (x=11.5, y=13.5) via a PipeGroup.
 – Unresolved pipe group segments near (x=-8.5, y=20.5) and (x=-2.5, y=21.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for iron gear wheel production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5).
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• A manual Transport Belt Chain composed of horizontal and vertical segments.
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) (WORKING).
• Boiler for fluid heating at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).
• Pipe Connection via a PipeGroup (e.g. fluid_system=153933) at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) carrying water (status: FULL_OUTPUT).
• An unresolved segmented pipe connection aimed at linking to a New Boiler near (x=-10.0, y=22.5).

### Expanded Smelting Zone
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace at (x=-20.0, y=22.0) placed successfully.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-20.0, y=25.0) placed successfully.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-17.0, y=25.0) placed successfully.
• An intended Stone Furnace at (x=-17.0, y=22.0) that could not be placed due to a blocking PipeGroup at (x=-17.5, y=21.5).

────────────────────────
New Network Structures
────────────────────────
### Long-distance Transport Belt Network at approximate span (input near x=-3.5, y=10.5; output near x=22.5, y=10.5)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with an input Belt at (x=-3.5, y=10.5) and an output Belt at (x=22.5, y=10.5) comprising 29 belts.
• Use-case: Facilitates long‐range material transfer between distant factory zones.

### Copper Ore Transport Line at approximate region (x≈8–9, y≈11–15)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with inputs: Belt at (x=8.5, y=11.5) (direction DOWN) and Belt at (x=7.5, y=15.5) (direction RIGHT); output: Belt at (x=8.5, y=15.5) (direction RIGHT) comprising 6 belts carrying copper-ore.

### Integrated Auxiliary Transport Network at approximate center (x≈3, y≈16)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with inputs from Belts at (x=2.5, y=13.5), (x=2.5, y=15.5), and (x=5.5, y=18.5) comprising 23 belts.
• A connected Belt Group with additional inputs from Belts at (x=3.5, y=16.5) and (x=2.5, y=25.5), and outputs from Belts at (x=3.5, y=16.5) and (x=4.5, y=16.5) comprising 16 belts.
• Use-case: Provides intermediate material transfer within localized production areas.

### Short Belt Connector A at approximate location (x≈-0.5 to -1.5, y≈20.5)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with an input Belt at (x=-0.5, y=20.5) and an output Belt at (x=-1.5, y=20.5) comprising 2 belts.
• Use-case: Links adjacent factory sections with a minimal belt segment.

### Short Belt Connector B at approximate location (x≈-4.5 to -5.5 and nearby segments)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with an input Belt at (x=-4.5, y=25.5) and an output Belt at (x=-5.5, y=25.5) comprising 2 belts.
• Additional belt segments at (x=-2.5, y=26.5) and (x=-1.5, y=27.5).
• Use-case: Enhances local belt connectivity in the higher-y production zone.

(Other structures from previous steps remain unchanged.)

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Inventory and Crafting:
 – Before executing placement actions, verify that the required item exists in inventory. Errors such as “No stone_furnace in inventory” and “No Small Electric Pole in inventory” indicate placement attempts without sufficient components.
 – Ensure all necessary raw materials and processed items (for example, at least 1 iron-plate and 2 copper-cables for crafting a Small Electric Pole) are available to meet recipe requirements.

• Fuel and Operational Readiness:
 – Burner Inserters frequently report “out of fuel” or “waiting for source items.” Monitor fuel levels closely and schedule timely coal refills to keep operations running smoothly.

• Power Network Connectivity:
 – NO_POWER warnings require due attention. When reinforcing the network by adding electric poles, always confirm inventory availability to avoid placement errors.
 – The recent placement actions (e.g. new poles at (3.5, 22.5) and (-4.5, 17.5)) help improve connectivity, but similar operations must be preceded by inventory checks.

• Fluid System Connectivity:
 – Boilers reporting “no input liquid” and “no fluid present in connections” necessitate a review of pipe configurations. Verify that pipes are properly linked to an accessible water source and that connection points are unobstructed.

• Placement Validation:
 – Errors in placing entities (as seen with the stone furnace at (-6.0, 19.0) and small electric pole at (-2.5, 20.5)) suggest that placement functions must validate inventory content prior to attempting placement.
 – Implement a preliminary inventory check for each placement action to mitigate repeated placement exceptions.
